Prepare the signal detection results for creation of table with results

prepare_signals_table.Rd

This function converts the columns week, year and cases to integer, columns are renamed and category with NA is replaced by None. It can filter the data based on the `signals_only` parameter giving back only those weeks where a signal was found.

Usage

prepare_signals_table(data, signals_only = TRUE)

Arguments

data

data.frame containing signals from get_signals

signals_only

Logical indicating whether to filter the signal results to include only the weeks when a signal was generated (default is TRUE). If set to TRUE, the signals column is removed from the table. When FALSE the signals column is kept to distinguish the weeks with and without alarms.

Value

data.frame

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
data <- data.frame(
  year = 2020:2022,
  week = 1:3,
  cases = 10:12,
  alarms = c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE),
  upperbound = c(15, NA, 14),
  category = c(NA, NA, NA)
)
prepare_signals_table(data)
} # }
